articles.author: Artorn Pookasook, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israel expanded its targets in its war with Hezbollah militants in Lebanon on Monday, killing at least 21 people in an airstrike in the north, health officials said, while millions of Israelis took shelter from projectiles fired back across the border.
articles.title: Israel strikes north Lebanon town, UN expresses concern about peacekeepers

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces tightened their squeeze around Jabalia in the north of the enclave, amid fierce battles with Hamas-led fighters.
articles.title: Israel kills at least 40 in Gaza, tanks deepen raid in the north

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea has blown up sections of an inter-Korean road on its side of the heavily militarised border between the two Koreas, South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said on Tuesday.
articles.title: North Korea blows up parts of inter-Korean road on its side of border, Seoul says

articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Israel may expand its ground operations against Hezbollah while bolstering its own defences.
articles.title: Israel's demining near Golan signals wider front against Hezbollah, sources say

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris campaigns in Detroit on Tuesday, aiming to shore up support among Black men by capping the trip to the crucial 2024 election state of Michigan by appearing with radio host Charlamagne tha God.
articles.title: Harris sits with Charlamagne, Fox, maybe Rogan as polls tighten

articles.author: Krishn Kaushik, Sakshi Dayal, Promit Mukherjee
articles.description: Canada alleged a broader effort to target Indian dissidents in the country.
articles.title: Canada expels top India diplomats, links them to murder of Sikh leader

articles.author: Tom Hals
articles.description: Voters, advocacy groups and the two main political parties have filed lawsuits over everything from the location of polling places to voter registration procedures.
articles.title: Some US voters head to court before they head to the polls

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia and China held "substantive" defence and military talks to bolster ties, Russia's defence minister said on Tuesday, as Moscow and Beijing cement a "no limits" partnership and step up criticism of U.S. efforts to extend its influence in Asia.
articles.title: Russia, China bolster defence ties at 'substantive' talks

articles.author: Max Hunder
articles.description: Four-fifths of Ukrainians said they supported a new law banning Russia-affiliated religious groups in a survey released on Tuesday, as Kyiv seeks to root out a branch of the Orthodox Church accused of cooperating with Moscow, which is waging war on Ukraine.
articles.title: Four-fifths of Ukrainians support ban of Russia-linked church in poll

articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: Marjayoun, a majority Christian town in southern Lebanon, opened its schools and a church last month to house scores of people fleeing Israel's bombardment of Muslim villages, extending a hand across the country's sectarian divide.
articles.title: Mass displacement in Lebanon war revives spectre of sectarian strife
